alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 9:07AM EST until January 04 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northern Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... Gadsden County in Big Bend of Florida... Northern Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 1030 AM EST/930 AM CST/. * At 907 AM EST/807 AM CST/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Donalsonville to near Chattahoochee to near Blountstown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Quincy, Blountstown, Havana, Marianna, Bainbridge, Midway, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Sneads, Gretna, Bristol, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Altha, Attapulgus, Climax, Brinson, Bascom and Rock Bluff. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM EST/100 PM CST/ for Big Bend of Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM EST/100 PM CST/ for Big Bend of Florida.
